newsitem.title: PERU: Telefonica del Peru places debt paper.
newsitem.headline: Telefonica del Peru places debt paper.

text.p: Peru's Telefonica del Peru placed Monday 41 million soles ($15.4 million) of corporate bills in local markets, company officials said.
Telefonica has now placed 117.6 million soles worth of debt paper since December in its planned global program of issues for a total of up to $180 million.
Telefonica plans to use money raised from the issue for expansion and renovation work, officials have said.

At an auction, the company placed 25 million soles in debt at 30 days with an average interest rate of 15.25 percent and 16 million soles of debt at 90 days with an average interest rate of 15.7 percent. It did not place 364-day commercial debt.
The company received bids for a total of 125.5 million soles out of a total of 80 million up for auction.
Its financial instruments carry A1+ and DPp1+ ratings by assessment firms Apoyo y Asociados and Duff and Phelps del Peru, respectivly.
Telefonica announced recently that it will invest between $550 million to $600 million this year, a figure below the $660 million it invested last year.
The company is controlled by Telefonica de Espana TEF.MCu, which bought the company from the Peruvian government in 1994 at a cost of $2 billion.
